required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Cardiac Safety in Patients With HER2 Positive Early Breast Cancer Treated With Herceptin
clinical_study.official_title: An Observational Study of Cardiac Events in Patients With HER2 Positive Early Breast Cancer Treated With Herceptin

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single cohort observational safety study. All patients will be treated and monitored according to the local clinical practice. No additional procedures/patient visits in comparison with the usual clinical practice are planned for the study. Data will be collected from centre's medical records for up to 5 years or death.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of symptomatic congestive heart failure\n(CHF) using New York Heart Association class II, III and IV, and cardiac death
primary_outcome.time_frame: On treatment and up to 5 years follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to onset and the time to recovery of symptomatic congestive heart failure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On treatment and up to 5 years follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of asymptomatic cardiac failure and other significant cardiac conditions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On treatment and up to 5 years follow-up

intervention.description: There is no planned investigational product or a treatment regimen prescribed by this protocol. Decision about a treatment regimen will be made according to the local practice and in the best interest of individual patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients who are considered candidates to receive Herceptin for this indication
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients for whom Herceptin is contraindicated
